1078318382213156866.text: 2. “The sharp drop in the payment success probability when high degree nodes were removed proves [...] them a pivotal point for the success of the network’s goals and a centralized point of failure which, in the future, could harm lightning’s resilience”

1078317531776147456.text:
Some key lines on the state of the lightning network: 
1.  “The network works well for payments whose volume does not exceed 2€ to 3€, failing for larger amounts.”

1078317396178489344.text: The network had strong growth during an observed period from Oct. 26th – Nov 26th, 2018, with a growth of 14.31% for the number of nodes and of 45.61% for the number of edges (nodes grew from 1642 nodes to 1877 nodes, and edges grew from 8506 to 12,386).pic.twitter.com/ESGEr3i7JE

1078317233712058369.text: Liquidity is highly dependent upon a relatively small number of nodes. Removal of these nodes significantly affects liquidity and increases average shortest path length.pic.twitter.com/kcFp82XRl5

1078317065449230338.text: The protocol specifies that the first payment path that should be tried by a sender is the shortest path between the sender and the receiver. The probability of success of these payments drops dramatically for anything greater than a couple Euro or dollar.pic.twitter.com/OB8HpoZKLy
